page.title: 08THE HARWORTH COLLIERY (2)
page.content: In 1924 the Harworth Colliery opened. The number of people working at the pit today is 1140.There are 240 men on the surface and 900 underground. Every year one million tons are mined.The coldest temperature down the pit is 0c in the winter.The hottest temperature is 28c and the best working temperature is 18c.In the early days miners started work at the age of 14.Nowadays they start at the age of 16.In the early days they could work until they were unfit.Now they have a set age which they have to retire at,if they work underground they retire at the age of 60.If they work on the surface they retire at the age of 65.Our pit is 1000m deep and 8km to east and west and 10km to north and south underground.
